publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1225 Des McNulty: Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident-That the Parliament notes that it is 18 years since the nuclear accident at Chernobyl occurred; further notes the terrible legacy in those countries most directly affected, namely Belarus, Ukraine and Russia; congratulates Scottish charities and civic organisations for their outstanding work in supporting individuals and communities affected, and recognises the need to take national and international action to avoid the possibility of future environmental catastrophes.

S2M-1225 Des McNulty: Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident-That the Parliament notes that it is 18 years since the nuclear accident at Chernobyl occurred; further notes the terrible legacy in those countries most directly affected, namely Belarus, Ukraine and Russia; congratulates Scottish charities and civic organisations for their outstanding work in supporting individuals and communities affected, and recognises the need to take national and international action to avoid the possibility of future environmental catastrophes.
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Sarah Boyack*, Jackie Baillie*
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Robert Brown*
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Rhona Brankin*
S2M-1225 Commemoration of Chernobyl Accident (lodged on 28 April 2004) Helen Eadie*
